It doesn’t though.  You simply proved my point.  You want specific rules from one verse to translate into another verse where that power system doesn’t exist.  Thus all the (positive) rules now exist but none of the negative rules do.  

Beyond that you have simply decided that power system A works, the same way in universe B as it did in A.  But of course power system B doesn’t work in universe A, because your argument falls apart otherwise.

This isn’t about the need for equalization, it’s about the fact that people cherry pick what they want to be true and then build arguments with the cherry picked information.  

So once more we circle back to my point.  “The verse I want to win; will always win because I’ve decided what will and won’t be accounted for.  This is a fair, balanced, and impartial ruling and how dare you disagree with me” /s

We all agree that power systems need some level of equalizing.  Or else the power system of which ever world the fight is taking place in, will always win.  Bleach loses to Black Clover because the power system of Bleach doesn’t exist in that media.  Thus soul reapers instantly die once they leave their world.  Quid pro quo Asta is stronger than Ichigo.   Fuck it, the power system doesn’t exist in Baki either.  So the character with no super powers is stronger than the character with super powers (who is show to be able to cut mountains in half).

That’s not the issue I’m addressing though.  I’m addressing the shit tier explaining authors do about how their power systems work and what the limits are.  Again, because they are almost always based off “the rule of cool” instead of a definitive rule set.

That is why power scaling verse to verse is fucking stupid and pointless.  Even if you allow the power systems to interact with each other, the durability, stamina, power, ect… are never defined.  So everyone is firing off endless versions of their most powerful attacks, at all times, forever.

I personally would have preferred a story where he’s older once everything starts to happen.  I think it would be interesting to see Steven have to deal with some of the stuff minus homeworld getting involved and minus the sudden power-ups that came along with that

You claim that Ichigo can’t be touched?  Why?  We have seen him be physically touched by humans.  We have seen Goku physically punch a literal god.  So what is stopping him from punching Ichigo?

Also how does one “fairly” equalize different powers?  Does the one shot gag comic where Usopp solos all the others verses count as canon? Or does the one shot gag manga where Kiba wins a fight against Hit, suddenly mean that several Naruto character are now “canonically” multiple times faster then light/immune to time manipulation?

The biggest issue with trying to scale this shit is that anime works off the “rule off cool” instead of a quantifiable power system.  How much ‘resource’ does (character) have?  How much of that resource does (signature attack) use? How much damage does that attack do?  How durable is (character); IE how many of that attack should they be able to withstand?  I mean fuck, we see Goku literally breaking reality trading punches with Berrus.  Then we later see Goku (in a stronger form) trading punches with multiple other characters and those blows aren’t even a fraction as impactful.
